results.title: The Human animal: a personal view of the human species. Part 2 (X)
results.creator_credit: BBC, Graham Booth, Mike Beynon and Martin Weitz
results.brief_description: Desmond Morris examines the ways in which human beings behave in terms of our “animal” instincts. The three episodes are: “The Biology of love” which is a scientific and biological approach to aspects of human love, courtship and sexuality. “The Immortal genes” examines human life from babyhood in terms of the Life Cycle. “Beyond survival” focuses on aspects of behaviour exhibited by human beings beyond those required for survival; in particular creativity and imagination. NB: Features full frontal nudity and specific scenes of sexual intercourse.

results.title: The Human animal: a personal view of the human species. - Part 1. (X)
results.creator_credit: BBC, Clive Bromhall, Mike Beynon and John MacNish
results.brief_description: Desmond Morris attempts to illustrate how the many ways human beings behave across cultures have their roots in our “animal” past. The three programs are: “The Language of the body” which examines the origins of our body language and how body language signals vary across cultures. “The Hunting ape” examines how our primeval hunting habits have been mainfested in activities such as sport and mob behaviour. “The Human zoo” looks at how urban humans deal with their tribalistic instincts. This episode contains some full frontal nudity.

results.title: The Hula fishermen and Koki market
results.creator_credit: Information and Extension Services for the people of Papua New Guinea
results.brief_description: Shows the daily work of men of the Hula tribe, who net and spear fish for marketing at Koki, Port Moresby. The market is shown as a social meeting place of varied Papuan peoples.

results.title: The Huge adventures of Trevor a cat; Trevor Island
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and John Taylor
results.brief_description: A combination of two animated films by John Taylor. “The Huge adventures of Trevor, a cat”. Trevor has his hunting instincts revived when he accidentally catches a bird. Encouraged by his success Trevor sets his sights even higher with disastrous and hilarious results. “Trevor Island” Trevor’s family move to a tropical island and decide to set up an airport and car park. A sedate lifestyle, however, is not to Trevor’s liking.

results.title: The Huge Adventures of Trevor a Cat/Foxbat and the Mimi
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, John Taylor and John Skibinski
results.brief_description: The hilarious story of a cat, whose hunting instincts are accidentally over-revived, plus the story of a flying fox which takes shelter in a cave, something he regrets when cave spirits attempt to capture him. Rated: G

results.title: The Hudsucker proxy
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Ethan Coen and Joel Coen
results.brief_description: Norville Barnes is an inexperienced college graduate who finds his first job working in the mail-room of the very profitable Hudsucker Industries. After Hudsucker Industries’ founder and Chairman falls to his tragic death, leaving behind no will and a stunned and panic-stricken board od directors, Vice-President Sidney Messburger sees a brilliant opportunity for taking over the company. He promotes the naive Norville to Company Chairman so as to devalue Hudsucker stocks so that the Board may acquire controlling interests. All doesn’t go according to plan, however when Norville’s new product, the Hula Hoop, is a raging success. Cast includes: Tim Robbins, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Paul Newman, Charles Durning, John Mahoney, Steve Buscemi and Peter Gallagher.

results.title: The Howling
results.creator_credit: AVCO Embassy Pictures, Michael Finnell, Jack Conrad and Joe Dante
results.brief_description: Joe Dante’s ‘The Howling’ is a witty and frightening update of the classic Universal Studio werewolf movies. Aided by a heavily referential screenplay by John Sayle’s and Terrence Winkless, (adapted from the Gary Brandner novel) it pays equal amount homage as well as being a fresh reinvention of the genre. Dee Wallace plays Karen White, a feisty reporter on the trail of a serial killer (Robert Picardo). After a frightening confrontation with the killer which leaves him dead and her traumatized, Karen’s doctor (Patrick Macnee) recommends her to take some time off. Under his advice Karen heads off to the ‘The Colony’, a secluded hideaway full of very strange residents harboring a terrifying secret. Joe Dante peppers the film with plenty of horror film references (many of the characters are named after Werewolf movie directors) and includes a slew of sly cameos like John Sayles and B-movie mogul Roger Corman. Cast includes John Carradine, Dennis Dugan, Christopher Stone, Belinda Balaski, Kevin, McCarthy, Slim Pickins and Elizabeth Brooks.

results.title: The Housewife
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover, Wolf Koenig and Cathy Bennett
results.brief_description: A study, in film animation, of a day in the life of a housewife, described without words, with a minimum of detail but with a perception all the more pertinent because of the simplicity of presentation. The film makes no judgments. It simply states the case, but serves as an apt starting point for any discussion of the role of women and the value of their work. (Award: Hilversun.)

results.title: The Housefly. - 3rd ed.
results.brief_description: Shows in detail the life cycle of the common housefly. Describes the many unusual physical adaptations that aid the housefly in rapid flight and in feeding. Explains how the housefly transmits germs and contributes to the spread of disease. Very clear description of houseflies, beginning with considerable discussion of its flight. It then moves on to other aspects of the fly’s physics, chemistry, biology and ecology. It has excellent photography and a very clear commentary.
